key_reasons: Patient has both positive RF (87 UI/mL) and positive anti-CCP (67 U/mL). This meets the RA+ signal of serology positivity.
The patient is currently on biologic therapy with adalimumab, which aligns with the RA+ signal for treatment use.

An ACR-EULAR score cannot be determined from the provided snippets, but a diagnosis of polyarthrite rhumatoïde (RA) has been confirmed multiple times in notes. This supports the presence of rheumatoid arthritis.
The patient was diagnosed as having polyarthrite rhumatoïde and is currently being treated for it.
red_flags: Missing ACR-EULAR score to definitively confirm RA+ status.
Alternative diagnoses such as osteoarthritis or bursitis should be ruled out, but they are not mentioned in the provided data.
questions_for_human: Is there any additional information regarding the ACR-EULAR score?
Were alternative joint diseases like osteoarthritis or bursitis excluded from the diagnosis? If so, how?
